text: It's Jeff Barr here at AWS in Seattle.

Here's a couple of launches 
that caught my eye this week.

AWS Deep Learning AMIs for Ubuntu 
and Amazon Linux now come

with advanced optimization
 teller for tenser flow 1.6.

The AMIs now include an optimize build 
that is pre-configured with cuda9 and cuDNN7,

to take full advantage of mixed precision 
training on P3 GPU-powered instances.

It also use Intel's events vector processing
 instructions to accelerate vector

and floating point operations 
on C5 instances for high performance.

AWS Fargate platform 
version 1.1.0 is now available.

This update has support for 
Amazon ECS task, metadata endpoints,

container health checks 
and ECS service discovery.

New platform versions are released 
as the runtime environment evolves,

including kernel or operating system updates,
new features, bug fixes and security updates.

You can now customize 
your users AppStream 2.0 experience

with your organization's logo,
 color scheme, text,

and help links in 
the applications catalog page.

Using your own brand provides
 a familiar look and feel
when users access your applications.

Adding your own help links makes it easy
 for your users to access support
resources within your organization.

Thanks for joining us this week 
for some of our launch highlights.

For the full state of recent launches, 
check out our “What's New” page.

Be sure to like this video and subscribe
 so you won't miss an update.

We'll see you next week with highlights 
from the AWS summit in San Francisco.
